alert.note: Alert for Boone; Calhoun; Clay; Jackson; Kanawha; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Roane; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Wirt (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Calhoun, southwestern Nicholas, Kanawha, southeastern Wirt, Roane, northwestern Raleigh, Clay, southeastern Jackson, Fayette and east central Boone Counties through 530 AM EDT... At 459 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Elkview to near Pratt to 6 miles south of Burnwell. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Charleston, Summersville, Fayetteville, Spencer, Clay, Oak Hill, Sissonville, Montgomery, Chesapeake, Marmet, Mount Hope, Ansted, Belle, Clendenin, Cedar Grove, East Bank, Glasgow, Smithers, Gauley Bridge and Pratt. This includes the following highways... Interstate 79 between mile markers 1 and 44. Interstate 77 in West Virginia between mile markers 96 and 98, near mile marker 103, near mile marker 105, between mile markers 107 and 109, and between mile markers 112 and 117. West Virginia Turnpike between mile markers 52 and 95. Route 19 between mile markers 7 and 44. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Boone; Calhoun; Clay; Jackson; Kanawha; Northwest Fayette; Northwest Nicholas; Roane; Southeast Fayette; Southeast Nicholas; Wirt
